articles.title: Biosketch
articles.contents:
Current position Research engineer in computational statistics at CEA
November 2019 - November 2022 Ph.D. candidate in Statistics at the Commissariat à l’Énergie Atomique et aux Énergies Alternatives (CEA) and at the Centre de Mathématiques Appliquées (CMAP), École Polytechnique
May 2019 - October 2019 End of study internship at EDF R&D, PRISME department.
September 2018 - April 2019
Master degree in Statistics and Machine Learning, Université Paris Sud
Third year major in applied mathematics, École Centrale Paris

September 2016 - June 2018 Engineer degree obtained at École Centrale Paris in 2019
September 2014 - June 2016 Preparation to national competitive entrance exam to french schools of engineering, Lycée Pierre de Fermat, Toulouse

articles.title: About me
articles.contents:
Research Interests
Uncertainty quantification
Computational statistics
Gaussian process regression
Current and past positions
Since November 2022, I am a research engineer in applied statistics and probability at CEA (French national laboratory on nuclear and renewable energies). 
From November 2019 to November 2022, I was a Ph.D. student in statistics at CEA
and Applied Mathematics Laboratory, École polytechnique, under the supervision of Josselin Garnier, PhD director, and Cyril Feau (CEA, EMSI).
Contact
You can write me an e-mail at: clement “dot” gauchy “at” cea “dot” fr

articles.title: Ph.D. thesis
articles.contents:
I defended my Ph.D. thesis, “Uncertainty quantification methodology for seismic fragility curves of mechanical structures - Application to a piping system of a nuclear power plant” on the 9th of November 2022 at Ecole polytechnique, before the jury composed by:
Dr. Cyril Feau (supervisor), CEA Saclay
Pr. Fabrice Gamboa (reviewer), Université Paul Sabatier
Pr. Josselin Garnier (Thesis director), Ecole polytechnique
Pr. Olivier Le Maître (examiner), Ecole polytechnique
Dr. Amandine Marrel (examiner), CEA Cadarache
Pr. Clémentine Prieur (examiner), Université Grenoble Alpes
Pr. Bruno Sudret (president of the jury), ETH Zürich
Pr. Alexandros Taflanidis (reviewer), University of Notre Dame
Mr. Emmanuel Viallet (guest), EDF Direction Technique
Here are the slides of the defense and the pdf file of the manuscript.
